title: By the definition: cont., avg. value, differentiable

content.question: Let f be the function defined by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mrow> <mo>{</mo> <mrow> <mtable columnalign="left"> <mtr columnalign="left"> <mtd columnalign="left"> <mrow> <msqrt> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </msqrt> </mrow> </mtd> <mtd columnalign="left"> <mrow> <mtext>for </mtext> <mtext> </mtext> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> </mtd> </mtr> <mtr columnalign="left"> <mtd columnalign="left"> <mrow> <mn>5</mn> <mo>−</mo> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mtd> <mtd columnalign="left"> <mrow> <mtext>for </mtext> <mtext> </mtext> <mn>3</mn> <mo><</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>5.</mn> </mrow> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> </mrow> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaWGMbGaaiikaiaadIhacaGGPaGaeyypa0Zaaiqaa8aabaqbaeaa biGaaaqaa8qadaGcaaWdaeaapeGaamiEaiabgUcaRiaaigdaaSqaba aak8aabaWdbiaabAgacaqGVbGaaeOCaiaabccapaGaaGjbV=qacaaI WaGaeyizImQaamiEaiabgsMiJkaaiodaa8aabaWdbiaaiwdacqGHsi slcaWG4baapaqaa8qacaqGMbGaae4BaiaabkhacaqGGaWdaiaaysW7 peGaaG4maiabgYda8iaadIhacqGHKjYOcaaI1aGaaiOlaaaaaiaawU haaaaa@5789@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> (a) Is f continuous at x = 3? Explain why or why not.

frqParts.text: Let f be the function defined by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mrow> <mo>{</mo> <mrow> <mtable columnalign="left"> <mtr columnalign="left"> <mtd columnalign="left"> <mrow> <msqrt> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </msqrt> </mrow> </mtd> <mtd columnalign="left"> <mrow> <mtext>for </mtext> <mtext> </mtext> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> </mtd> </mtr> <mtr columnalign="left"> <mtd columnalign="left"> <mrow> <mn>5</mn> <mo>−</mo> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mtd> <mtd columnalign="left"> <mrow> <mtext>for </mtext> <mtext> </mtext> <mn>3</mn> <mo><</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>5.</mn> </mrow> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> </mrow> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaWGMbGaaiikaiaadIhacaGGPaGaeyypa0Zaaiqaa8aabaqbaeaa biGaaaqaa8qadaGcaaWdaeaapeGaamiEaiabgUcaRiaaigdaaSqaba aak8aabaWdbiaabAgacaqGVbGaaeOCaiaabccapaGaaGjbV=qacaaI WaGaeyizImQaamiEaiabgsMiJkaaiodaa8aabaWdbiaaiwdacqGHsi slcaWG4baapaqaa8qacaqGMbGaae4BaiaabkhacaqGGaWdaiaaysW7 peGaaG4maiabgYda8iaadIhacqGHKjYOcaaI1aGaaiOlaaaaaiaawU haaaaa@5789@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> (a) Is f continuous at x = 3? Explain why or why not.
(b) Find the average value of f(x) on the closed interval 0 ≤ x ≤ 5.

(c) Suppose the function g is defined by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mrow> <mo>{</mo> <mrow> <mtable columnalign="left"> <mtr columnalign="left"> <mtd columnalign="left"> <mrow> <mi>k</mi> <msqrt> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </msqrt> </mrow> </mtd> <mtd columnalign="left"> <mrow> <mtext>for</mtext> <mtext> </mtext> <mtext> </mtext> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> </mtd> </mtr> <mtr columnalign="left"> <mtd columnalign="left"> <mrow> <mi>m</mi> <mi>x</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </mtd> <mtd columnalign="left"> <mrow> <mtext>for </mtext> <mtext> </mtext> <mn>3</mn> <mo><</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>5</mn> <mo>,</mo> </mrow> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> </mrow> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaWGNbGaaiikaiaadIhacaGGPaGaeyypa0Zaaiqaa8aabaqbaeaa biGaaaqaa8qacaWGRbWaaOaaa8aabaWdbiaadIhacqGHRaWkcaaIXa aaleqaaaGcpaqaa8qacaqGMbGaae4BaiaabkhapaGaaGjbVlaabcca peGaaGimaiabgsMiJkaadIhacqGHKjYOcaaIZaaapaqaaiaad2gaca WG4bGaey4kaSIaaGOmaaqaa8qacaqGMbGaae4BaiaabkhacaqGGaWd aiaaysW7peGaaG4maiabgYda8iaadIhacqGHKjYOcaaI1aGaaiilaa aaaiaawUhaaaaa@593D@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> where k and m are constants. If g is differentiable at x = 3, what are the values of k and m?

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
